intro: Platycoryne latipetala var. grandiflora, commonly known as the broad-petaled platycoryne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
